alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; Goshen County; Niobrara County; North Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 6:11PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Niobrara, northwestern Goshen and northern Platte Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 611 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sibley Peak, or 21 miles north of Wheatland, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Guernsey, Glendo, Sibley Peak, Guernsey Campground, Glendo Reservoir, Two Moon Campground and Hartville. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 92 and 112. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM MDT for southeastern and east central Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; Goshen County; Niobrara County; North Laramie Range
